[33mUsage:[39m
 behat [-s|--suite="..."] [-f|--format="..."] [-o|--out="..."] [--format-settings="..."] [--init] [--lang="..."] [--name="..."] [--tags="..."] [--role="..."] [--story-syntax] [-d|--definitions="..."] [--append-snippets] [--no-snippets] [--strict] [--rerun] [--stop-on-failure] [--dry-run] [paths]

[33mArguments:[39m
 [32mpaths                [39m Optional path(s) to execute. Could be:
                       - a dir [33m(features/)[39m
                       - a feature [33m(*.feature)[39m
                       - a scenario at specific line [33m(*.feature:10)[39m.
                       - all scenarios at or after a specific line [33m(*.feature:10-*)[39m.
                       - all scenarios at a line within a specific range [33m(*.feature:10-20)[39m.
                       - a scenarios list file [33m(*.scenarios)[39m.

[33mOptions:[39m
 [32m--suite[39m (-s)          Only execute a specific suite.
 [32m--format[39m (-f)         How to format tests output. [33mpretty[39m is default.
                       Available formats are:
                       - [33mprogress[39m: Prints one character per step.
                       - [33mpretty[39m: Prints the feature as is.
                       You can use multiple formats at the same time.[33m (multiple values allowed)[39m
 [32m--out[39m (-o)            Write format output to a file/directory instead of
                       STDOUT [33m(output_path)[39m. You can also provide different
                       outputs to multiple formats.[33m (multiple values allowed)[39m
 [32m--format-settings[39m     Set formatters parameters using json object.
                       Keys are parameter names, values are values.[33m (multiple values allowed)[39m
 [32m--init[39m                Initialize all registered test suites.
 [32m--lang[39m                Print output in particular language.
 [32m--name[39m                Only executeCall the feature elements which match part
                       of the given name or regex.[33m (multiple values allowed)[39m
 [32m--tags[39m                Only executeCall the features or scenarios with tags
                       matching tag filter expression.[33m (multiple values allowed)[39m
 [32m--role[39m                Only executeCall the features with actor role matching
                       a wildcard.
 [32m--story-syntax[39m        Print [33m*.feature[39m example.
                       Use [32m--lang[39m to see specific language.
 [32m--definitions[39m (-d)    Print all available step definitions:
                       - use [32m-dl[39m to just list definition expressions.
                       - use [32m-di[39m to show definitions with extended info.
                       - use [32m-d 'needle'[39m to find specific definitions.
                       Use [32m--lang[39m to see definitions in specific language.
 [32m--append-snippets[39m     Appends snippets for undefined steps into main context.
 [32m--no-snippets[39m         Do not print snippets for undefined steps after stats.
 [32m--strict[39m              Passes only if all tests are explicitly passing.
 [32m--rerun[39m               Re-run scenarios that failed during last execution.
 [32m--stop-on-failure[39m     Stop processing on first failed scenario.
 [32m--dry-run[39m             Invokes formatters without executing the tests and hooks.
 [32m--profile[39m (-p)        Specify config profile to use.
 [32m--config[39m (-c)         Specify config file to use.
 [32m--verbose[39m (-v)        Increase verbosity of exceptions.
 [32m--help[39m (-h)           Display this help message.
 [32m--config-reference[39m    Display the configuration reference.
 [32m--version[39m (-V)        Display this behat version.
 [32m--no-interaction[39m (-n) Do not ask any interactive question.
 [32m--colors[39m              Force ANSI color in the output. By default color support is
                       guessed based on your platform and the output if not specified.
 [32m--no-colors[39m           Force no ANSI color in the output.
